The claim states that NAFTA: supported by Secretary Clinton, cost the US 800,000 jobs nationwide.
The claim is based on a report by the Ec: which found that the US trade deficit with Mexico and Canada increased from $17 billion to $177.2 billion from 1993 to 2013, displacing 851,700 US jobs.
The Congressional Research Service: a nonpartisan policy arm of Congress, stated in a report that it is difficult to determine the exact effects of NAFTA on job losses and economic gains, but overall, NAFTA did not cause the huge job losses feared by critics or the large economic gains predicted by supporters.
